title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4240.1 - Purpose
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4240.1 - Purpose

State Regulations

The purpose of these regulations is to set forth and codify
the application process, eligibility criteria and procedure for the
corporation, through a cooperative agreement with the New York State Department
of Transportation, to administer the Small, Minority and Women-owned Business

Enterprises Transportation Capital Assistance and Guaranteed Loan Program, authorized and to be funded from the appropriation made by the appropriating
legislation. The purpose of the program is to provide financial assistance to
small, minority and women-owned business enterprises engaged in government
sponsored, transportation related construction projects. The corporation will
also seek to establish affirmative action goals for participation in program
projects by minorities and women pursuant to the Urban Development Corporation

Act. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21

4240.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
